Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the protective gear made by China is faulty, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides a short video clip showing ripped protective gowns without providing any context or further evidence to support the claim that the gear is faulty.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the faulty protective gear is made by China based on the caption of the video, without verifying the accuracy of this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation that the protective gear seen in the video was produced in France and became damaged in storage before the COVID-19 crisis.
